Articles.Content:
I just purchased a new 43" 4k tv that i use as my monitor for my pc, and having 2 issues. The major problem is the frame rate/stutter, about once a second the game will will skip a beat so to speak, but just the graphics, the audio is fine. And oddly enough, it's not as bad when i'm in the vab/sph, just everywhere else. I tried one of my saved ships, 100ish parts, and made one just for a test that was 5 stock parts and no difference. maybe change the frame rate in the game settings to 60 from 120? already have the graphics settings in the game turned all the way down. Didn't have this issue when i was using a 43" 1080p tv as a monitor unless the part count got too out of hand, and even then it wasn't choppy, just slow. Not running a LOT of mods either, 44 I think, and aside from Outer Planets Mod and its dependencies, most are just parts/propulsion from mods like kw, b9, kspi, near future, etc. 

The other issue, is of course the font size when in map mode and some menus. Text is literally 1-2 millimeters tall, i've lowered the screen resolution from 4k to 1080p, increased the scaling, all that stuff and nothing is working. And even if the text did get big enough to read, the mouse pointer is so huge, maybe 2cm^2, it would cover it all up anyway.

If you need more info, let me know. Thanks.

Game versions 1.2.2, 1.3, 1.3.1

PC specs:

stock Acer Aspire

Windows 10 64bit

7th gen Intel Core i3 7100 @ 3.9ghz

Intel HD graphics 630 (upgrading to a gtx 1050 2gb card)

1TB HD

8GB DDR4

Edited February 26, 2018 by MoonPies

On 26-2-2018 at 2:57 AM, MoonPies said:

Intel HD graphics 630 (upgrading to a gtx 1050 2gb card)

Do you already have the GTX1050 or are these results on the intergraded graphics?

7 hours ago, DrLicor said:

Do you already have the GTX1050 or are these results on the intergraded graphics?

I have it ordered and should be here by the weekend.

I think the intergraded graphics don't support the TV. But you'll find that out when you've installed your graphic card. 

The small tekst and symbols are a known thing with higher resolution monitors sadly..

On 2/25/2018 at 7:57 PM, MoonPies said:

I just purchased a new 43" 4k tv that i use as my monitor for my pc, and having 2 issues. The major problem is the frame rate/stutter, about once a second the game will will skip a beat so to speak, but just the graphics, the audio is fine. And oddly enough, it's not as bad when i'm in the vab/sph, just everywhere else. I tried one of my saved ships, 100ish parts, and made one just for a test that was 5 stock parts and no difference. maybe change the frame rate in the game settings to 60 from 120? already have the graphics settings in the game turned all the way down. Didn't have this issue when i was using a 43" 1080p tv as a monitor unless the part count got too out of hand, and even then it wasn't choppy, just slow. Not running a LOT of mods either, 44 I think, and aside from Outer Planets Mod and its dependencies, most are just parts/propulsion from mods like kw, b9, kspi, near future, etc. 

The other issue, is of course the font size when in map mode and some menus. Text is literally 1-2 millimeters tall, i've lowered the screen resolution from 4k to 1080p, increased the scaling, all that stuff and nothing is working. And even if the text did get big enough to read, the mouse pointer is so huge, maybe 2cm^2, it would cover it all up anyway.

If you need more info, let me know. Thanks.

Game versions 1.2.2, 1.3, 1.3.1

PC specs:

stock Acer Aspire

Windows 10 64bit

7th gen Intel Core i3 7100 @ 3.9ghz

Intel HD graphics 630 (upgrading to a gtx 1050 2gb card)

1TB HD

8GB DDR4

 I  had  these  exact  same  problems, and  oddly  enough  I  also  had  a 1050ti  on  the  way.

Once  I  had  installed  it  and  the  drivers  the  problem  went  away, hopefully  its  that  easy  for  you  also
4K on integrated graphics. That's your problem, don't search any further, upgrade your GPU or downgrade to 1080p.
